security: This record relates to an interview conducted with an agency employee regarding a separate individual. Disclosing the personal details of the interviewee (Mrs. Bustos-Videla) could violate her privacy and potentially expose sensitive agency information. Additionally, revealing the interview process itself, including the identities of the interviewers, could compromise internal security protocols.
summary: This is a memorandum summarizing an interview with Charlotte Z. Bustos-Videla regarding her acquaintance with Agee; she offered no additional information but suggested contacting Dorothy Hennick regarding possible contact between Agee and Jim Noland.
summary_one_paragraph: On January 10, 1973, James E. Peters and William A. O'Donnell interviewed Charlotte Z. Bustos-Videla, an Operations Officer located in Room 3-E-04 with extension 6954, concerning her acquaintance with Agee, as documented in a previous memorandum dated May 31, 1972; Bustos-Videla provided no new details on Agee but recommended contacting Dorothy Hennick in Bern to determine if Agee had been in contact with Jim Noland of Mexico Station.
title: Interview with Charlotte Z. Bustos-Videla Regarding Agee
